Vocabularies.Definition: n.  学会，学院，研究院
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   If you want to be a musician, you go to the Royal Academy of Music.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a person or thing added 增加的人（或物）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The baby is a welcome addition to the Smith family.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. one of two or more possibilities 供选择的东西
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Check out the alternatives before deciding whether to go to a nearby college.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  天使
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She is in heaven with the angels.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 盎格鲁-萨克逊人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The Anglo-Saxons did not have a letter V.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. provoke (a particular feeling or attitude) 唤起，激起
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   These educational toys give children a feeling of self-worth by arousing their interest in challenging tasks.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  forbid (sth.) officially 禁止，取缔
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The local government will ban smoking in all offices later this year.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 密封小容器；胶囊；航天舱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The space capsule had three astronauts.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a sudden great disaster 大灾难
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The flood was a major catastrophe, causing heavy loss of life.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 凯尔特人
n.  海峡，渠道，频道
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The English Channel separates Britain from France.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  基督教 Christian a. 基督教的 n. 基督教徒
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Most of my friends believe in Christianity.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a work of art recognized as having lasting value 经典作品
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His manual on botany has become a classic among scientists.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  (an area or a region with) a regular pattern of weather conditions 气候（区）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Brought up in the south of China, she wouldn't enjoy living in such a cold climate.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.    take possession and control by force; defeat 征服
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Afghanistan's Northern Alliance conquered Kabul a month ago.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. cause errors to appear in; cause to act dishonestly in return for personal gains  讹用，使（语言）变得不标准；腐蚀，贿赂
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The Academy ruled that such foreign expressions were not permitted as they corrupted the language.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   of or involving culture 文化的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The Foundation（基金）promotes cultural and educational exchanges between China and Britain.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the notional environment in which communication over computer networks occurs 网络空间，虚拟空间
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   In computer technology, cyberspace refers to databanks and networks, considered as a space.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  丹麦（人）的，丹麦语的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He was the son of a Danish father and a Venezuelan mother.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  come down (from a source), go down 起源于，下来
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   These ideas descend from those of the ancient philosophers.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 信徒，门徒
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   one of the disciples of Christ

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  move or go somewhere in a slow casual way 漂泊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Jimmy spent the year drifting around Europe.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.　the group regarded as the best （总称）出类拔萃的人，精英
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The army was controlled by a small elite of officers.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  make rich or richer; improve 使富裕，使丰富
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   That once poor coastal village has been enriched by the profits from tourism.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  cause to be, set up 建立，确立
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The school was established in 1905 by an Italian professor.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  of great interest or attraction 迷人的，有极大吸引力的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The story of his adventures in the Arctic was fascinating to listen to.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  by good luck 幸运地，幸亏
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Fortunately, my friend survived the car accident.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  日耳曼（人）的，日耳曼语的，德国（人）的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He asked in his Germanic English if I was enjoying the visit.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 语法学家
n. 希腊语
a. 　done as a habit, regular, usual 惯常的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She was a habitual daydreamer.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 印欧语系的
n.  影响
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Parents have greatest influence on their children.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  live in (a place) 居住于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   This island is inhabited only by birds.

Vocabularies.Definition: n., a.  知识分子（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The book does not appeal to real intellectuals.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   enter with armed forces  侵入，侵略
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The Germans invaded Poland in 1939, leading to the start of World War II.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  发明 invention n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   James Watt invented the steam engine.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 国王（般）的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Waving his arms in a kingly manner, he led his company back to the royal dwellings.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  拉丁语
n.  freedom 自由
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The constitution guards the liberty of the people.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a person who studies languages 语言学家
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He is an accomplished linguist.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 制造商
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The company is the world's largest doll manufacturer.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   殉难者，烈士
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He is a glorious martyr to the cause of peace.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  large in scale, amount, or degree 大量的，大规模的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The ancient temple's massive stone pillars had begun to crumble.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 杂乱状况 messy a.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   As the work is in messiness you'll need to wear old clothes.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  change slightly 修改，更改
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The school authorities plan to modify the school regulations.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  神秘的事物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The politician's sudden death remains a mystery to us all.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 必需品；必要（性）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   A lot of people would consider a TV as more of a necessity than a luxury item.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.,a. 诺曼人(的), 诺曼语(的), 诺曼文化的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   In Norman England, the greyhound was a symbol of nobility.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.（古）斯堪的纳维亚语
滋养，培育
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Journalists on the whole don't create public opinion. They can help to nourish it.

Vocabularies.Definition: 失去控制，不受约束
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The fire was out of control by the time the second fire engine arrived.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 游行；阅兵队列 hit parade a weekly listing of the current best-selling pop records 流行唱片目录
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The small boys loved watching the soldiers on parade.

Vocabularies.Definition: hand or give (sth.) to (sb.) 将…传给…
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   When you have finished reading the novel, please pass it on to Laura.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  独占的地区或范围；禁猎地 vt. keep from harm, damage, etc., protect; save 保护，保存
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   No hunting allowed in this preserve.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 产品
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   They go to the market to buy supplies and sell their products.

Vocabularies.Definition: 将…付诸实施
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Having delayed several times, we must put this plan into practice now.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  （欧洲14-16世纪的）文艺复兴
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Science took a new and different turn in the Renaissance.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. be like or similar to 与…相似
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I'd say he resembles his mother more that his father.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 古罗马的，拉丁语的
a.  国王或女王的；皇家的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The newborn baby was welcomed not only by the Japanese royal family but by the country at large.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   梵语
n. 学者
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The library attracts thousands of scholars and researchers.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a small meal 快餐，点心 snack bar   快餐柜，小吃店
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I usually have a snack of a hamburger and a glass of coke at lunchtime.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  源，来源
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Tourism, which is a major source for income for the city, has been seriously affected by the terrorist attacks.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  (of power) without limit, highest;(of a nation) fully independent 拥有最高统治权的，至高无上的；拥有主权的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The Russian Federation declared itself to be a sovereign republic.

Vocabularies.Definition: 严格地讲
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Strictly speaking, it is not one house at all, but three houses joined together.

Vocabularies.Definition: create, produce 创造，开创
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   After working for his father for about ten years, he decided to strike out on his own.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   give in 投降
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   They would rather die than surrender.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   done according to a system 有系统的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The police began a systematic search of the building.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  温度计
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   A thermometer is an instrument for measuring temperature.

Vocabularies.Word: to a (very real, certain, etc.) extent
Vocabularies.Definition: to the degree specified 在（极大，某种）程度上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I agree with him to some extent, but there are still some areas of sharp disagreement between us.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 容忍，宽容；忍耐
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   School teachers have to have a great deal of tolerance in order to deal with difficult children.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  译本，译文；翻译
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Hundreds of translations of the Bible have been prepared.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   部落
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The tribe held religious ceremonies next to a river.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.,a.  录像（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Video has been made wide use of for teaching.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  for the most part, almost 差不多，几乎
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It's virtually impossible to tell the imitation from the real thing.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  词汇（量）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He has an English vocabulary of about 5,000 words.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a small cassette player 随身听
a.,n.  威尔士语（的），威尔士人（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The Welsh eat more potatoes than anyone else.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  狼
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   A wolf is a wild animal that looks like a large dog.
